summary: Dependency vulnerability in ajv-5.5.2 (CVE-2020-15366) transitively included via istanbul-instrumenter-loader and schema-utils. The vulnerability allows prototype pollution through carefully crafted JSON schemas, though the direct dependency has no available fix.
userImpact: Users are exposed to a prototype pollution vulnerability through a transitive dependency that could potentially lead to code execution if untrusted schemas are processed.
rootCause: ajv-5.5.2 contains CVE-2020-15366 which allows prototype pollution via specially crafted JSON schemas; included transitively through istanbul-instrumenter-loader -> schema-utils -> ajv
proposedFix: Upgrade ajv to version 6.12.3 or later, though this requires upgrading the direct dependencies that use it
resolutionDetails: Issue was automatically closed/reopened by Mend automation; marked as resolved when vulnerable library was removed from inventory or marked as ignored
keyQuote: CVE-2020-15366: A carefully crafted JSON schema could be provided that allows execution of other code by prototype pollution
